infodynamics.measures.continuous
Class ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon

java.lang.Object
  infodynamics.measures.continuous.ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian
public abstract class ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate

Base class for implementations of ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, e.g. kernel estimation, Kraskov style extensions. It implements some common code to be used across conditional mutual information calculators

Author:
Joseph Lizier, joseph.lizier at gmail.com

dimensionsCond

var1Observations

protected double[][] var1Observations
The set of observations for var1, retained in case the user wants to retrieve the local entropy values of these. They're held in the order in which they were supplied in the addObservations(double[][], double[][], double[][]) functions.

var2Observations

protected double[][] var2Observations
The set of observations for var2, retained in case the user wants to retrieve the local entropy values of these. They're held in the order in which they were supplied in the addObservations(double[][], double[][], double[][]) functions.

condObservations

protected double[][] condObservations
The set of observations for the conditional, retained in case the user wants to retrieve the local entropy values of these. They're held in the order in which they were supplied in the addObservations(double[][], double[][], double[][]) functions.

protected int totalObservations
Total number of observations supplied. Only valid after finaliseAddObservations() is called.

Provide the complete set of observations to use to compute the mutual information. One cannot use the addObservations(double[][], double[][], double[][]) style methods after this without calling initialise(int, int, int) again first.

addObservations

public void addObservations(double[][] var1,
                            double[][] var2,
                            double[][] cond)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate

Adds a new set of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Must be called after ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate.startAddObservations(); call ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

Note that the arrays must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

Specified by:
addObservations in interface ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate
Parameters:
var1 - multivariate observations for variable 1 (first index is time, second is variable number)
var2 - multivariate observations for variable 2 (first index is time, second is variable number)
cond - multivariate observations for the conditional (first index is time, second is variable number)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

finaliseAddObservations

public void finaliseAddObservations()
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Finalise the addition of multiple observation sets. This default implementation simply puts all of the observations into the var1Observations, var2Observations and condObservations arrays. Usually child implementations will override this, call this implementation to perform the common processing, then perform their own processing.

Specified by:
finaliseAddObservations in interface ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Allow child classes to throw an exception if there is an issue detected specific to that calculator.

computeSignificance

public EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance(int variableToReorder,
                                                            int numPermutationsToCheck)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate

Compute the significance of obtaining the given average measure from the given observations.

This is in the spirit of Chavez et. al., "Statistical assessment of nonlinear causality: application to epileptic EEG signals", Journal of Neuroscience Methods 124 (2003) 113-128.

Basically, we shuffle the observations of the named variable against the other tuples. This keeps the marginal and joint PDFs of the unshuffled variables the same but destroys any correlation between the named variable and the others.

Specified by:
computeSignificance in interface ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate
Parameters:
variableToReorder - 1 for variable 1, 2 for variable 2
numPermutationsToCheck - number of new orderings of the source values to compare against
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
"Chavez et. al., 'Statistical assessment of nonlinear causality: application to epileptic EEG signals', Journal of Neuroscience Methods 124 (2003) 113-128"

computeSignificance

public EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance(int variableToReorder,
                                                            int[][] newOrderings)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception

As per computeSignificance(int, int) but supplies the re-orderings of the observations of the named variable.

We provide a simple implementation which would be suitable for any child class, though the child class may prefer to make its own implementation to make class-specific optimisations. Child classes must implement Cloneable for this method to be callable for them, and indeed implement the clone() method in a way that protects their structure from alteration by surrogate data being supplied to it.

Specified by:
computeSignificance in interface ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate
Parameters:
variableToReorder - 1 for variable 1, 2 for variable 2
newOrderings - first index is permutation number, i.e. newOrderings[i] is an array of 1 permutation of 0..n-1, where there were n observations. If the length of each permutation in newOrderings is not equal to numObservations, an Exception is thrown.
newOrderings - the specific new orderings to use
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

computeAverageLocalOfObservations

public double computeAverageLocalOfObservations(int variableToReorder,
                                                int[] newOrdering)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception

Compute the mutual information if the given variable were ordered as per the ordering specified in newOrdering.

We provide a simple implementation which would be suitable for any child class, though the child class may prefer to make its own implementation to make class-specific optimisations. Child classes must implement Cloneable for this method to be callable for them, and indeed implement the clone() method in a way that protects their structure from alteration by surrogate data being supplied to it.

Specified by:
computeAverageLocalOfObservations in interface ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate
Parameters:
variableToReorder - 1 for variable 1, 2 for variable 2
newOrdering - array of time indices with which to reorder the data
Returns:
a surrogate MI evaluated for the given ordering of the source variable
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

computeStartAndEndTimePairs

public java.util.Vector<int[]> computeStartAndEndTimePairs(boolean[] var1Valid,
                                                           boolean[] var2Valid,
                                                           boolean[] var3Valid)
Compute a vector of start and end pairs of time points, between which we have valid series of all variables. Made public so it can be used if one wants to compute the number of observations prior to setting the observations.

Parameters:
var1Valid -
var2Valid -
Returns:
